comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Based on your logs the temps of every chip reach around 80 above which is the miner automatically adjusts to a lower hashrate that is why your miner it's not running at high-performance mode.I heard that the temp limit for Avalon units is around 85c so if you can cool down your miner a bit maybe you can boost the miner's hashrate. If cooling down the temp does not work try the aging method using FMS tool you can download it from this link below- https://canaan.io/service/447

comments.author: Plhy
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on June 16, 2022, 10:57:07 PMBased on your logs the temps of every chip reach around 80 above which is the miner automatically adjusts to a lower hashrate that is why your miner it's not running at high-performance mode.I heard that the temp limit for Avalon units is around 85c so if you can cool down your miner a bit maybe you can boost the miner's hashrate. If cooling down the temp does not work try the aging method using FMS tool you can download it from this link below- https://canaan.io/service/447Thank you for your answer.I'll try it.Previously, miner operated in high preformance even at chip temperatures around 90 ° C. There was no problem. A friend has the same Avalon and his chips work at a temperature of 90-95 ° C and he has no problems.Is the software from your link installed on a PC and I connect to the miner via a network (UTP) cable? I can't lower the temperature. I would need to work ideally somewhere around 85-90 ° C.Thank you so much

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: Plhy on June 17, 2022, 11:04:10 AM~snip~Is the software from your link installed on a PC and I connect to the miner via a network (UTP) cable? I can't lower the temperature. I would need to work ideally somewhere around 85-90 ° C.Thank you so muchWell based on their manual the TMAX shouldn't exceed more than 85c I don't know what firmware exactly your miner using but that is the max limit temp for this unit. About the software yes you need both miner and PC and must be connected to the same network.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: rk7660 on June 24, 2022, 06:13:50 AMHi. Did you solve your problem. If not then reply , i had faced  this issue also.Would you mind trying the aging method? I heard someone solve their issue about hashrate or performance by using the aging method. You can use this tool FMS_tool_v2.3.3 then go to aging tab then choose your miner. Or you can send this command below under diagnoseCode:[{"command":"ascset", "parameter":"0,aging-set,1"}]Then update here if your case solve after aging.

comments.author: rk7660
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on June 24, 2022, 10:58:54 PMQuote from: rk7660 on June 24, 2022, 06:13:50 AMHi. Did you solve your problem. If not then reply , i had faced  this issue also.Would you mind trying the aging method? I heard someone solve their issue about hashrate or performance by using the aging method. You can use this tool FMS_tool_v2.3.3 then go to aging tab then choose your miner. Or you can send this command below under diagnoseCode:[{"command":"ascset", "parameter":"0,aging-set,1"}]Then update here if your case solve after aging.I already solved my problem. one of my hashboard temp. goes upto 85 c . then after cleaning my hashboard i changed my over temp. hashboard in to the middle position. Now my maximum temp. comes upto 80-81 c. and miner working good from last 3-4 days.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: rk7660 on June 27, 2022, 12:14:00 PMI already solved my problem. one of my hashboard temp. goes upto 85 c . then after cleaning my hashboard i changed my over temp. hashboard in to the middle position. Now my maximum temp. comes upto 80-81 c. and miner working good from last 3-4 days.That is what I told him if he can able to reduce or cool down the temp a bit the miner can mine at high-performance mode. That's the only reason why it automatically drops in hashrate is due to overheating one easy solution is to clean all dust from hashboard and both fans or improve the fan speed. If you don't know how to improve or increase the fan speed you can manually send this command below with the FMS app under diagnose.Code:[{"command":"ascset","parameter":"0,fan-spd,100"}]The 100 from that command is the speed of 100% you can change it to lower than that if you want a bit slower.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Does your pool report the same hash rate?Having the miners - from anyone - report the wrong speed is not unheard of. I had a s9 that reported 20+THs and have an A10 (33T) that insists it's running at 90T. Go fig. Don't think I've ever had one report too low but I can see it happening.

comments.author: Plhy
comments.body: Quote from: NotFuzzyWarm on September 30, 2022, 08:01:07 PMDoes your pool report the same hash rate?Having the miners - from anyone - report the wrong speed is not unheard of. I had a s9 that reported 20+THs and have an A10 (33T) that insists it's running at 90T. Go fig. Don't think I've ever had one report too low but I can see it happening.Pool shows approx. 1 TH/s more.But the temperatures rise to a power level of 85 Th/s. But I don't get full power. Only heat and higher temperature of the hash boards .I'm already desperate.Should I try to find the software and update? Where can I get secure software? Write an email to Avalon?

Write an email to Avalon?I already told you to try the FMS tool in my previous post but it seems you didn't do anything if you use the FMS tool with Aging it will calibrate all hash boards to optimize them and set to full potential.Without trying or testing any suggestions here you will never solve this issue. So please try my suggestion it should fix your issue.

The "Aging" command helped.Currently, on the 4th day, asic works at 85 Th/s.I really appreciate your advice. thank you very muchIf you know more commands in the FMS tool, I will be happy if you write them to me.
